text: On tap - caramel color with a wall of lacing. Has a nice caramel or molasses aroma and a smooth malty caramel taste. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Excellent brew.

On tap @ Triple Rock. Amber pour with a small white head. Aroma is caramel, light peat, and a fair amount of dark fruit. Good raisin and toast. Sweet malty flavor. Lots of caramel and toast. Dark fruit notes of raisin and plum. Some peat, smoke, and a touch of chocolate.

A very nice scotch style ale. Pours a very nice dark red. Smells like bourbon. Taste is very sweet up front, with a smokiness and a bourbon, but not boozy finish. Very interesting. Had on tap at the brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A - Served a clear red with just a touch of orange mixed in and a thin finger of frothy slightly off-white head. Head fades slowly with some good lace.

S - Aroma is a mix of rich sweet caramel malts with a touch of earthy hops coming through.

T - Starts off some rich sweet caramel malt with a bit of a syrupy taste. Through the middle a bit of earthy hop comes through with some more caramel malt. The finish is a mix of rich caramel malt sweetness with some light bitterness.

M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a lightly syrupy feeling and a sweet and lightly warming finish.

D - Very drinkable. Fairly rich and sweet, but still well balanced and not overbearing.
On tap, aroma is mildly malt and caramel. Flavor also follows this, but with a sweetness.

8 ounce sample on tap at the brewpub.  Very sweet caramelly aroma with some hints of peat.  Light roastiness, and minimal smoke present.  Nicely aromatic.  Transparent garnet-amber body with a medium off-yellowish head and good lacing.  Starts sweet, sticky, and caramelly.  Becomes a bit peaty and a little smoked in the middle.  Some buttery diacetyl seems present late, which is mildly off-putting.  Long-lasting roastiness late.  Scantly burnt.

Pours amber with an off white head. The aroma is very smoky and grainy with a touch of peated malt. The flavor is nice with smoke and caramel. Very silky and smooth on the palate. The finish is smoky and and bitter with  a touch of roasted malt. Big flavor and mouthfeel for a smaller beer. A nice treat for Scottish ale lovers.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours with a mostly clear amber hued body with a small, off-white head. Aromas are malty, lightly smokey, raisins, caramel, bready and slightly sweet. Clean, no hop aromas or fermentation character. Flavors are lightly smokey, raisiny, and caramel. Very noticeably bitter for the style. A bit too much, but still enjoyable (ratings are not to style anyway). Medium bubbles, smooth finish.
Draft. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel and straw.

Sample at the brewpub on 8/8/10. Pours clear reddish copper with a medium tan head. Caramel malt nose with peat, roast, chocolate and a bit of metal. Toasty caramel flavor with chocolate, peat and a roasty bitter finish. Nice.

Dark red-amber color with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel and cream soda. Flavor is moderately bitter with lots of residual sweetness. The sweetness isnt so bad, but I think they should try barrel aging some of this. Decent overall.
I had this on tap at the brewpub. Its a clear dark amber pour with a minimal head. Nice malty, peaty flavor, enjoyable.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours amber with a thin beige head and a fruity aroma. There is a substantial caramel malt flavor wiht a dry bitter finish.

On tap at the brewpub pouring clear amber with copper edges and thin white head. The modest aroma emits sweet malts mixed with ripe cherries, caramel malts and a touch of resiny hop grassiness. The taste is sweet with malts along with thin layers of ripe cherries, sweet raisins and caramel malts. Smooth tasty brew.
Clear copper red with a fizzy head. Malt toffee and molasses aroma and taste decent.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours almost clear and golden deep orange with a small white head. Aroma is distinct roasted malt, light toffeeish yet dry. Sweet caramelish flavoured, nice roasted note to a smooth toffee flavour and light bitterness coming through. Ends lingering caramel malt flavoured and light bitter.

Date: July 08, 2009
Mode: Draft
Source: Brewpub
Appearance: hazy dark amber, fine beige head
Aroma: sweet malt aroma, light earthyness
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, dark caramel sweetness, just a hint ogf caramel candy, light earthyness for balance
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: **+/4

Tap at the brewpub.  Nose is very metallic with grains.  Color is redder than I think of the style being but I may be overly restrictive there.  Flavor is missing some peat for my taste, and is both thinner and short-finishing than the best of the style (AleSmith, Founders) seem to be.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a malty hoppy caramel aroma with some roasted hints. Sweetish slightly roasted malty caramel flavor with some hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty caramel finish.

Minimal head, though well made.  The bitterness level is fantastic, as well is the mouth-feel.  Very pleased with the dryness which also makes for the well hidden 7% alcohol.  They were out of their IPA, but this was my favorite of five when I was there.

Poured from tap at Triple rock brewing a clear brown with a small off white head.  Aroma was soft with wood, caramel, and barnyard funk(hay, straw).  The flavor had a bit of hay, toast, soft caramel, some wood, and malt.  The palate is not very sweet and mildly bitter.  Just didnt have a whole lot of flavor, rather bland or maybe just didnt pair well with what I was eating.  Ill have to go back and try without food.

Draft from cask.  Beautiful, lasting tan head on this bronze beer. Aroma bready, with floral tones as well. Buttery, smooth mouthfeel, with creamy & soft bubbles. Tasted quite different from Tree Frog Ale- a bit sharper, in fact.  I enjoyed!Earlier Rating: 11/20/2007 Total Score: 3.1Floral & sweet at first taste, becoming less sweet, almost dry, towards the end.  A bit hoppier than I had expected, with some spicy end notes.  Thin mouth feel,  medium carbonation, no head whatsoever.  Strong alcohol flavors balanced by fruitiness in some swallows.  I ate this w/ a decent chicken sandwich & slaw, which may have affected some of my experience...

On draft at the brewpub (7.6%). Deep roasted malt aroma with a touch of smoke. Very dark amber color with a minimal beige head. Medium body and very mild carbonation. Dark roasted flavor with no real sign of hop. The finish is a bit sweet, balanced only by the roasted aspect. Eventually some bitter does build up in the mouth.
GABF 2007:  Poured a clear amber color with an off-white head.  Light fruit and chocolate make up the aroma.  Milk chocolate flavor with toasty and nutty malt.  medium body.
Another great nutty, stoney, scotch ale. That seems to be their specialty. Very good stuff.

(On tap) Claimed to be 7.6% ABV. Clear, orangey brown with an off-white head. Nutty aroma. Fairly full-bodied with an extremely soft mouthfeel. Malty, nutty character with some alcohol. The finish is dry. 200307
Draft. Rich amber beer with an off-white head. Low malty aroma. Caramel, cocoa flavor with a bit of light citrus hop backing. Lots of malt, but hops linger. Medium-light bodied and easy drinking.

Clear copper body with minimal white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, cherry, some herbal/grapefruit.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, grapefruit/herbal, light cherry, mild alcohol.  Medium-full body.
Tap. Hazy brown ale with a faint nose of biutterscotch. Leafy tatse. sweet start with not much hops. Not well balanced. Lighter bodied lacking in something. (June 2004).
(strong beer month 04 in san francisco)   This english style ale pours copper colored.  Very smooth for the high abv but lacking any distinguishable flavors.  A bit sweet with some caramel.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2003 Tap.  First rating (6,3,6,3,15) Amber color with a laced creamy head.  Malty caramel.  Not much fruit in this scotch ale, but a nice rich malty beer.  Re-Rate (6,3,7,3,14) at the brewpub.  Brown color with a tan head.  Malty, caramel, wood, and a touch of fruit.
A fan of English strong ales since the mid 70s when I slammed my 1st one. Robust malt nose, some sweetness, and a nice bite that lingers long on the palate.
